Articles.Content: When I place my lander inside the 3.75m-2.5m petal adapter then connect the adapter to the point where my engine and fuel tank meet then try to decouple my main rocket so I can turn around and take the probe out, the main rocket just sticks to the adapter. The probe properly decouples but the main rocket (the part above the adapter) wont come loose. When I click decouple, the screen wobbles for a few seconds then the main rocket sticks. I made sure the probe isn't too long and its not attached to the engine. Is it just not compatible with the new KSP update?

KW didn't get an actual update to 1.02. If I recall, Kickasskyle or Winston (whoever put the update out) rushed to get it out to go on vacation or something, overlooking a ton of bugs that arose. Someone HAS made a hotfix in the meantime that can be found [here.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/51037-1-02-KW-Rocketry-v2-7-Available-1-02-Compatibility%21-16-05-2015?p=1969805#post1969805) Keep in mind that the patch has some issues still.

I found a dropbox file on that link that said it fixed some bugs. I placed it in the KW rocketry folder like they said but it didn't fix the petal adapter. Did I put the .cfg file in there wrong or does this fix just not cover the adapter?
Connect to the bottom of the engine and it should make a fairing over the engine if remember right it has been that way O maybe around .25 hope it helps.

I guess my only hope is that they will come out with another update for KW because the adapter wont add a shroud over the engine. For some reason the adapter links up with the node of a decoupler but it wont turn green. So no Saturn V simulation for now sadly.

I know I'm bringing a dead thread alive, but I found a solution to the issue. If you make the root part below the petal adapter and then attach the bottom node of the upper parts engine it will work. You can then use the nudge tool to stick the engine inside the fairing like normal.
what I did was attach the engine to the adapter fairing and offset the adapter fairing
